metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23852 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.4 has a signed integer overflow inXML_GetBuffer, for configurations with a nonzero XML_CONTEXT_BYTES.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2').
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
